node.title: ‘The Cuisine of Indian Jews’ at the Museum of Food and Drink
node.description: Attend a virtual talk with Esther David, the author of “Bene Appétit: The Cuisine of Indian Jews.”
node.content: ["The Bene, or Bene Israel, is a group of Jews in India said to have arrived there many centuries ago. Esther David, who is a member of the community living in Ahmedabad, India, will discuss its food and traditions in a virtual event for the Museum of Food and Drink in New York City. Those foodways and customs have been preserved over time, as she describes in her book \u201cBene App\u00e9tit: The Cuisine of Indian Jews.\u201d There will be a prerecorded session with Krishnendu Ray, a professor of food studies at New York University, followed by a live conversation between Dr. Ray and the food writer and New York Times contributor Joan Nathan.", "Follow NYT Food on Twitter and NYT Cooking on Instagram, Facebook and Pinterest. Get regular updates from NYT Cooking, with recipe suggestions, cooking tips and shopping advice."]
